content: beginner versatile knit mesh tote pattern created by lea pin llamas this pattern is designed with beginners in mind but most certainly would be fun for all knitters it s made with 4 weight aran/ worsted weight cotton to be easily cleaned without pilling although i m sure it d be great with acrylic as well if used for something not sandy youtube tutorials things needed ~ 5mm us size 8 circular knitting needles ~ 450 yards of 4 weight cotton you will more than likely have about 30 yards extra but i wanna make sure you ve got enough it mathed out to needing about 437 yards but a little extra is a good thing i am a very loose knitter so it took me about 650 yards to be safe grab extra ~ stitch markers… lots of them i suggest the safety pin type you ll want a good 10 at least you will need a stitch marker that is different from the others to help identify your beginning of the new row this can be a different color or 2 linked together… something that will help you know where your beginning is ~ some way of row counting when we get into the mesh area it may be tricky to count those row correctly so having something on the ready to help is best ~ a tapestry or straight needle to weave in ends and sew on the straps ~ scissors or snips to cut ends ~ point protectors to not lose your work ~ helpful to have a crochet hook size 4mm or 5mm to help pick up stitches gauge 4st x 5 row per inch 16st x 20 row per 4 or 10cm straps make 2 cast on 5 i recommend the knit cast on but do the one you like row 1 knit 5 turn work row 2 purl 5 row 3-90 repeat row 1 and 2 44 times i highly suggest placing a stitch marker on the side of every 10th row cast off 5 the base remember to turn your work after finishing each row cast on 8 row 1 purl 8 place a stitch marker on your work on the left and right side of the work at this row this will help later on row 2 knit 1 increase i prefer the knit front and back 1 knit 4 increase 1 knit 1 10 stitches on your
